sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Remote Access Tool - Anydesk Execution From Suspicious Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)

match_context.values: @{Product=AnyDesk; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; Hashes=SHA1=9D8FB1F0FB7664CE2443E1EEC9115D2833539D8B,MD5=705FDF5D27C1D8F39986FD45EF7A4593,SHA256=660DA1824C143DE666903C2B3983DF605A3494A9DDAA7B65919E1263B095E343,IMPHASH=4BA63558D75F3D5D835B501189DD7F56; Description=AnyDesk; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\Explorer.EXE; CommandLine="C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\DarkCyan-fa1d3_Install.exe"; FileVersion=9.5.7; ParentImage=C:\Windows\explorer.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\DarkCyan-fa1d3_Install.exe; Company=AnyDesk Software GmbH}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Execution of Powershell with Base64
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Commandline to launch powershell with a base64 payload

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
When C# is compiled dynamically, a .cmdline file will be created as a part of the process.
Certain processes are not typically observed compiling C# code, but can do so without touching disk.
This can be used to unpack a payload for execution

match_context.values: @{Image=C:\Windows\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\dqdewlgc\dqdewlgc.cmdline}
@{Image=C:\Windows\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\idcgjel2\idcgjel2.cmdline; EventID=11}
